ARABIC: لَعَلَّنَا نَتَّبِعُ ٱلسَّحَرَةَ إِن كَانُوا۟ هُمُ ٱلْغَٰلِبِينَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: so we can follow the magicians if they are the winners?'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: (They said): "We may haply follow the magicians if they are victorious."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: We may perhaps follow the religion of the magicians if they triumph."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: and the people were asked, "Will you all be there so that we may follow the magicians if they become victorious?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: The people said, “Perhaps we may follow the magicians if they are victorious.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: That we may follow the sorcerers if they are the winners."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Haply we may follow the magicians, if they are the vanquishers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Haply we shall follow the sorcerers if it should be they are the victors.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: (They said): Aye, so that we may follow the wizards if they are the winners.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: so that we may follow the magicians, if they be the winners."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Belike we may follow the magicians if they are the winners?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: ‘Maybe we will follow the magicians, if they are victors!’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: That we may follow the sorcerers (in religion) if they win?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: That we may follow the sorcerers [who were on Fir'aun's (Pharaoh) religion of disbelief] if they are the winners."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: in order that we shall follow the sorcerers if they are the victors'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: That we may follow the magicians, if they are the winners.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: That we might follow the magicians if they are the predominant?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [26:40] Maybe we will follow the sorcerers, should they be the victors’ (the interrogative [of the previous verse] is an incitement to assemble and the optative sense [implicit in la‘alla] is due to their anticipation of victory, and hence their continued adherence to their religion and rejection of Moses).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (They said): Aye, so that we may follow the wizards) that we may follow the religion of the wizards (if they are the winners) against Moses.
